intro: Hieracium dasycodon, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium dasycodon is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
